author: Rachel Bachman
title: The Olympics’ Most Polarizing Sport
text:
Forget immigration: Women’s hockey might be the nation’s most polarizing subject.
Democrats are 29% more likely than the general population to watch women’s hockey in the Winter Olympics, which open Friday in Pyeongchang. Republicans are 44% less likely to watch it.
Those are two findings of a poll by Deep Root Analytics into voters’ Olympic... RELATED VIDEO Pyeongchang Winter Olympics: A Drone's View Pyeongchang, a tiny ski resort in a remote corner of South Korea, has transformed itself into the host of the largest-ever Winter Olympics. Here’s how the Games look from a drone’s perspective.
